title: How to Make Sugar Paste More Pliable

steps.headline: Knead the sugar paste.
steps.description: Before trying to add anything, give the sugar paste a good knead. It may be all that is needed.

steps.headline: If the kneading doesn't work out, try adding a tiny bit of vegetable fat.
steps.description: Use white vegetable fat, as this will match the color of the sugar paste. As with any cooking, add only a very small amount first; you can always increase but not reduce additions.

steps.headline: If the kneading and the little addition of vegetable fat hasn't helped, get your dough hook into action.
steps.description: Add the paste to the bowl and let the dough hook process it briefly.

steps.headline: When rolling sugar paste out, run a palette knife under it every few rolls to help stop it from sticking.
steps.description: It can even stick to a dusted surface, so use this trick often.

steps.headline: Always leave extra room when covering a cake.
steps.description: Aim to have more sugar paste than the cake size when covering the cake. This means that you will have room for error, as extra length can be trimmed off.

text: Knead the sugar paste. Before trying to add anything, give the sugar paste a good knead. It may be all that is needed. If the kneading doesn't work out, try adding a tiny bit of vegetable fat. Use white vegetable fat, as this will match the color of the sugar paste. As with any cooking, add only a very small amount first; you can always increase but not reduce additions. If the kneading and the little addition of vegetable fat hasn't helped, get your dough hook into action. Add the paste to the bowl and let the dough hook process it briefly. When rolling sugar paste out, run a palette knife under it every few rolls to help stop it from sticking. It can even stick to a dusted surface, so use this trick often. Always leave extra room when covering a cake. Aim to have more sugar paste than the cake size when covering the cake. This means that you will have room for error, as extra length can be trimmed off.
